intro: Schranckia quinquefaria, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and clusters of showy, violet-colored flowers. The plant typically grows in a compact, upright form, with stems that are often short and stout. Its flowers are borne on long, slender pedicels, adding to its ornamental appeal. Schranckia quinquefaria is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is well adapted to warm, humid environments.
